value.name: Since George Floyd's Murder, Killings by Police Have Continued
value.description: The following is a chronicle, in no way comprehensive, of police shootings since George Floyd was killed May 25, 2020.

video.name: Despite Outrage, Police Killings Continued Since George Floyd’s Murder

value.name: Woman wounded during Waukegan police shooting sues city, officers involved
value.description: Waukegan police have said that Williams and her boyfriend, 19-year-old Marcellis Stinnette, fled after an officer — identified in the lawsuit as Keating — approached the car they were sitting in.

value.name: Protest Planned In Waukegan After Officer Fatally Shoots Marcellis Stinnette
value.description: Protesters planned to march in north suburban Waukegan on Thursday, after police shot and killed 19-year-old Marcellis Stinnette, and wounded his girlfriend during a traffic stop this week.

value.name: Protesters Say Firing Of Waukegan Police Officer Who Shot And Killed 19-Year-Old Marcellis Stinnette Is Not Enough
value.description: A vigil will be held Saturday for Marcellis Stinnette, the 19-year-old shot and killed by a Waukegan police officer. 9 Year Old Raising Money For A BillboardThe child needs a kidney transplant.

value.name: Police video does not show fatal shooting of Black teen, attorneys say
value.description: Police officers did not have their body cameras turned on during the fatal shooting of Illinois teen Marcellis Stinnette, his family's attorneys said Wednesday.

value.name: Girlfriend of fatally shot Black man: Police covered him 'while he was still breathing'

value.name: Illinois police officer fired after killing Black teen
value.description: A police officer who fatally shot Marcellis Stinnette and wounded his girlfriend Tafara Williams has been fired. The FBI has joined an investigation into the shooting.

value.name: Full List of 229 Black People Killed by Police Since George Floyd's Murder
value.description: U.S. George Floyd Police Killings Police brutality Black Lives Matter At least 229 Black people have been killed by police officers across the U.S. in the year since George Floyd's murder.
